steps.action: Make sure you have already completed the setup procedures first, including creating a new directory for project tests.
steps.title: Setup and create yyyy-mm-dd directory.

steps.action: Make sure you have clone the ace3p-extensions repository, either https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmb/plugins/ace3p-extensions.git or git@gitlab.kitware.com:cmb/plugins/ace3p-extensions.git, and are using the current master branch.
steps.title: ace3p-extensions repository

steps.expect: modelbuilder to open a directory browser dialog
steps.title: New project

steps.action:
In that dialog, navigate to the test directory you created in the setup procedure and create a subdirectory 
track3p_Window
. Select the new subdirectory and click the OK.
steps.expect: modelbuilder to display a "Specify New Project" dialog with the "Workspace Directory" and "Name (Subdirectory)" fields set.
steps.title: New project directory yyyy-mm-dd/track3p_Window

steps.action: Set the "Simulation Template File" to the ACE3P template that is in the ace3p-extensions repository at `simulation-workflows/ACE3P.sbt`.
steps.title: Simulation template "ACE3P.sbt"

steps.action: Set the "Geometry File" to `data/model/3d/netcdf/Window.ncdf`. You will need to set the extension dropdown to "netcdf".
steps.title: Geometry model "Window.ncdf"

steps.expect: modelbuilder to close the dialog, then display the model geometry in the 3D view and update the Attribute Editor to display a "Modules" tab. On some systems, the model is not immediately displayed, but instead it appears when the "Resources" tab is selected. If that occurs, add a comment to the GitLab issue. Verify that there are two items listed in the "Resources" panel, labeled `sbi.default` and `Window`.
steps.title: Apply

steps.expect: modelbuilder Output Messages to include "Saved Project".
steps.title: Save Project

steps.action:
• Select whether to record or play the test. In general, you should select PLAY if the xml file is available.
  • If you select PLAY, use the "Tools" => "Play Test..." menu item and navigate to the "track3p_Window.xml" file.
  • If you select RECORD, use the "Tools" => "Record Test..." menu and specify "track3p_Window.xml" as the file.
steps.title: Begin record/play track3p_Window.xml

steps.action: In the Attribute Editor "Modules" tab, select "Track3P" as the Module. This should display a second dropdown labeled "Track3P. In that second dropdown, select "Multipacting".
steps.expect: Attribute Editor to display new tabs "Analysis", "Field Scaling", "Emitter", "Material", "Postprocess".
steps.title: Select Track3P module

steps.action: In the "Input Data" section, check the "Source" checkbox. A "Path" field should appear - copy this text into it":" /global/cscratch1/sd/johnt/test1/JOBID/s3p_results
steps.title: Set input data

steps.action:
Select the "Analysis" tab, then
  1. Set "Total Particle Tracking Time (Cycles)"" to 10
  2. Set "Localize Bins" to 128
  3. Enable "Solid Region" and set the dropdown field to "volume 2"
  4. Enable "Vacuum Region" and set the dropdown field to "volume 1"
steps.title: Analysis

steps.action:
Select the "Field" tab, then
  1. Set "Type" to "Input Port Power - W".
  2. Set Set "Scan Token" to "0":"" Single Field Level".
  3. Set "Scale" to 8.0e+6
steps.title: Field Scaling

steps.action:
Select the "Emmiter" tab, then
  1. Click "New" to create an attribute and rename it "emitter-type5"
  2. Set "Type" to "5":"" Solid Electronic Surface"
  3. Set "Region Bounds Min (m)" to 0, 0, -0.002
  4. Set "Region Bounds Max (m)" to 0.045, 0.045, 0
  5. In the "Attribute Associations", assign "surface 6 - Window"
In the same "Emmitter" Panel
  1. Click "New" to create a second attribute and rename it emitter-type2
  2. Set "Region Bounds Min (m)" to 0.001, 0.001, -0.002
  3. Set "Region Bounds Max (m)" to 0.045, 0.045, 0
  4. In the "Attribute Associations", assign "surface 6 - Window"
steps.title: Emmitter

steps.action:
Select the "Material" tab, then
  1. Select "Absorber" and click "New"; assign surfaces 1, 2, 7, 8.
  2. Select Primary and click "New"; click the "Secondary" checkbox; assign surface 6.
  3. Select Primary and click "New"; assign volume 2.
steps.title: Material

steps.expect: modelbuilder Output Messages to include "Saved Project".
steps.title: Save Project

steps.action: If you are recording the test, click the "Stop Recording" button to save the xml script.
steps.title: Finish record/play

steps.action:
From the "Project" menu
  1. Select "Export Project" to open the "Simulation Export Dialog".
  2. Click the "Apply" button. Expect the dialog to close.
steps.title: Export
